posts.post_content:
How is this card rated below a 3?! Lifelink for 1CC is pretty awesome, especially with all of the combos that can be created with lifegain.
  
   
Throw this on an unblockable guy or a flyer and go bannans. Black/White can combo with [Sanguine Bond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sanguine Bond) and really hurt someone very quickly.
  
   
4/5

posts.post_content: the ability of Lifelink is practically useless without a creature capable of using a [Pyroclasm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyroclasm) ability. the health gain isnt worth it on small creatures, while larger creatures are better dedicated to deterrence. Creatures such as [Oros, the Avenger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oros, the Avenger) are the best targets for this because they not only deal a significant amount of damage to a player, but they also splatter the field with damage, creating a mas sive vortex of health on the field

posts.post_content: For everyone that asks, lifelink (the keyword ability) does not stack as of the M10 rules changes. Multiple instances are redundant, which means casting Lifelink (the spell) on [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) is pointless; it doesn't give her double lifelink.
posts.html:
For everyone that asks, lifelink (the keyword ability) does not stack as of the M10 rules changes. Multiple instances are redundant, which means casting Lifelink (the spell) on Baneslayer Angel is pointless; it doesn't give her double lifelink.

posts.post_content:
@ Gaussgot, it gets rated less than 3 because it's a bad card. Costing only one mana doesn't make it any better, it just causes it to be a cheap bad card. 1/5
